entities.name: CollectiveKnowledge
observations: Central hub for high-value, transferable programming patterns
Contains only proven solutions applicable across multiple projects
Focus: architectural decisions, performance patterns, reusable designs

observations.content: Apply viewport culling when rendering 200+ 3D objects, use advanced techniques for 800+ objects
camera.position.distanceTo(object.position) < threshold
Balanced marker-centric culling: protected zone around marker (maxEvents/4), proportional left-right removal, stride-based thinning
Basic: 200 objects → ~20-50 visible, <10 FPS → 60 FPS. Advanced: 75-90% reduction in rendered objects
Advanced pattern prevents visual jumping with protected zones and gradual object removal
Essential for any 3D scene with many objects - Three.js, React Three Fiber, timeline visualizations
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ViewportCullingPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Rendering 200+ 3D objects causing performance issues (basic) or 800+ objects with visual jumping (advanced)
quick_reference.action: Basic: camera.position.distanceTo(object.position) < threshold. Advanced: balanced marker-centric culling with anti-jump algorithm
quick_reference.avoid: Rendering all objects regardless of visibility, naive culling without performance testing, visual jumping during culling
quick_reference.check: Basic: 60 FPS with 200+ objects. Advanced: 75-90% reduction in rendered objects, smooth 60fps with 800+ objects

observations.content: NEVER useState for complex state - ALWAYS Redux slices with typed hooks
const value = useSelector(state => state.feature.value); dispatch(action())
Feature-based slices: ui, timeline, preferences, repository, logging
For 20+ components: Model-View-Intent architecture with Redux store + 5 slices + 4 intent files for async operations
Predictable state, time-travel debugging, persistence integration. Advanced: zero prop drilling, full TypeScript coverage
Basic: 15+ components, cross-component state. Advanced: 20+ components with state management chaos
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ReduxStateManagementPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: React component with complex state (3+ properties, cross-component sharing, or 20+ components)
quick_reference.action: Use Redux Toolkit with createSlice() and typed hooks. For large apps (20+ components): implement MVI architecture with intent layers
quick_reference.avoid: useState for complex state, prop drilling, direct state mutation, mixed state management approaches
quick_reference.check: Basic: minimal useState usage. Advanced: zero prop drilling, 100% TypeScript coverage, predictable state flow

observations.content: 3D timeline visualization with React + Three.js
Implemented viewport culling and Redux state management patterns
Source of multiple transferable performance and architecture patterns
Complex autonomous driving system visualization with 7V5R processor architecture
Real-time animation of sensor data flow, processing, and timing diagrams
Origin of the sophisticated ConditionalLoggingPattern with dual-axis filtering
Advanced timing visualization system with interactive elements
Modular routing system for different sensor types (Camera, Radar, LiDAR)
Performance-optimized animation pipeline handling complex state transitions
Comprehensive documentation with UML diagrams and architectural patterns
Use single coordinated animation loop for 15+ simultaneous components
Standardized lifecycle with requestAnimationFrame coordination and event-driven state management
Maintains 60fps with complex processor and sensor animations
Dynamic registration/unregistration, graceful error handling, async task tracking
Any system requiring coordinated animation management
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/StateDrivenAnimationPipelinePattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Need to coordinate 15+ simultaneous animation components
quick_reference.action: Implement standardized lifecycle: initialize → start → pause → stop → destroy with single requestAnimationFrame loop
quick_reference.avoid: Multiple uncoordinated animation loops, missing error handling, lack of graceful cleanup
quick_reference.check: Verify 60fps maintenance with complex animations and proper component registration/cleanup

observations.content: Use strategy pattern for multiple routing algorithms with runtime registration
Extensible architecture with specialized algorithms: curved paths, obstacle avoidance, boundary calculations
Handles 50+ simultaneous connections, <5ms simple routes, <20ms complex routes
Dynamic boundary calculations, collision detection, configuration-driven behavior
Network visualization, circuit design, game pathfinding
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/StrategyBasedModularRoutingPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Need multiple routing algorithms for different connection types (50+ connections)
quick_reference.action: Implement strategy pattern with runtime registration and extensible architecture
quick_reference.avoid: Hard-coded routing logic, single routing algorithm for all cases, performance bottlenecks
quick_reference.check: Route calculation <5ms simple routes, <20ms complex avoidance routes

observations.content: Complex React applications with 20+ components suffer from state management chaos, prop drilling, and unpredictable updates
Implement Model-View-Intent (MVI) architecture using Redux Toolkit with separate slices and intent layers
Redux store with 5 slices (ui, timeline, preferences, repository, logging) and 4 intent files handling async operations
Zero prop drilling, predictable state updates, time-travel debugging, and 100% TypeScript coverage
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/MVIReduxArchitecturePattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: React app with 20+ components suffering from state management chaos
quick_reference.action: Implement MVI architecture using Redux Toolkit with separate slices and intent layers
quick_reference.avoid: Prop drilling, unpredictable state updates, mixed state management approaches
quick_reference.check: Zero prop drilling, 100% TypeScript coverage, predictable state flow

observations.content: Need to integrate Three.js 3D graphics with React component lifecycle and state management
Use React Three Fiber for declarative 3D scene management with React patterns
Canvas wrapper with hooks, refs for Three.js objects, and React event handling
Seamless integration of 3D graphics with React's declarative paradigm
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ReactThreeFiberIntegrationPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Need to integrate Three.js 3D graphics with React component lifecycle
quick_reference.action: Use React Three Fiber for declarative 3D scene management with React patterns
quick_reference.avoid: Manual Three.js integration, bypassing React lifecycle, imperative 3D code
quick_reference.check: Seamless integration of 3D graphics with React's declarative paradigm

observations.content: Component organization becomes chaotic in large React applications
Feature-based component organization with clear domain boundaries
components/three/, components/layout/, components/ui/ structure
27 components organized in logical directories with zero circular dependencies
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ModularComponentArchitecturePattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Component organization becoming chaotic in large React applications
quick_reference.action: Implement feature-based component organization with clear domain boundaries
quick_reference.avoid: Flat component structure, unclear boundaries, circular dependencies
quick_reference.check: Zero circular dependencies, logical directory structure, clear domain separation

observations.content: Duplicated stateful logic across multiple components
Extract common logic into reusable custom hooks
useViewportFiltering, useTimelineAnimation, useCameraControl hooks
DRY principle applied to React hooks with full TypeScript support
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/CustomHookExtractionPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Duplicated stateful logic across multiple React components
quick_reference.action: Extract common logic into reusable custom hooks with TypeScript support
quick_reference.avoid: Duplicated component logic, inline complex state management, non-reusable patterns
quick_reference.check: DRY principle applied with full TypeScript support and reusable hooks

observations.content: NEVER console.log - ALWAYS Logger.log(level, category, message)
Dual-axis filtering system with level-based and category-based controls
Logger.log(level, category, message) with configurable output targets
Centralized logging control, runtime filtering, production-ready debugging
Any application requiring sophisticated logging control and filtering
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ConditionalLoggingPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Need sophisticated logging control with dual-axis filtering (level + category)
quick_reference.action: Implement Logger.log(level, category, message) with configurable filtering and output targets
quick_reference.avoid: console.log usage, hardcoded logging levels, single-axis filtering
quick_reference.check: Zero console.log usage, configurable logging levels, category-based filtering working
